document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Ariptyelus Matsumura (Hemiptera: Cercopoidea: Aphrophoridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the genus Ariptyelus Matsumura (Hemiptera: Cercopoidea: Aphrophoridae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Aphrophora auropilosa
Matsumura, 1907
, Annot. Zool. Jpn. 6 : 113 .

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Peuceptyelus auropilosus (
Matsumura, 1907
)
[transferred by
Schumacher, 1915
: 88
].
Ariptyelus auropilosus (
Matsumura, 1907
)
[transferred by
Matsumura, 1940
: 50
].

subSubSection.paragraph:
Ariptyelus kikuchii
Matsumura, 1942
, Ins. Matsum. 16 : 47 [synonymised by
Liang, 1998
: 252 ].
Ariptyelus shokanus
Matsumura, 1942
, Ins. Matsum. 16 : 47–48 [synonymised by
Liang, 1998
: 252 ]. Type depository: EIHU (
Komatsu and Hayashi, 1998
).

Coloration: Eyes yellowish brown; antenna brown, third segment dark brown; vertex brown, dark brown centrally, median carina brown to dark brown, except light brown at base. Frons in dorsal view dark brown, median carina yellow to light brown; frons in ventral view with basal part brown, central area light brown, transverse band dark brown, apical part yellow; genae and base of mouth parts brown to dark brown. Pronotum with anterior two thirds yellowish brown, posterior part brown to dark brown. Mesoscutellum brown to dark brown, yellow at tip. Tegmen (
Fig. 1
C) dark brown, apical half brown without mark; transverse band incomplete at middle, costal margin darker than that on cubital area. Hind leg dark brown.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 4.
Ariptyelus auropilosus (Matsumura, 1907)
: A, Male genitalia, lateral view; B, pygofer, ventral view; C, left genital style, outer lateral side; D, the same, inner lateral side; E, aedeagus, phallobase, and connective, lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Structure: Head width: body width: body length= 1 : 1.3 : 2.9 . Head in ventral view rhomboid, about 1.2 times wider at base than middle long; about 3.3 times wider than long from dorsal aspect. Pronotum wider than median length at widest part about 1.7 : 1 . Tegmen (
Fig. 1
C) subquadrate, anal margin: posterior margin: length of tegmen = 1 : 2.1 : 3.1 ; LBW: LMW: LT= 1 : 1.5 : 3.2 . Wings (
Fig. 1
D) with 4 apical cells, apical cells with first longer than third 1.7 : 1 . Wing coupling apparatus with 4 hooks (
Fig. 1
D) on basal part of costal margin. Hind tibia with apical spines arranged in 2 rows, upper row with 7 spines, lower one with 8 spines.

Male Genitalia: Pygofer in lateral view (
Fig. 4
A), wider than long about 1.3 : 1 ; basal margin of pygofer reclined apically, curved basally at ventral third, then protruding basally and curved ventrally; dorsal process of pygofer conelike, directed posteriorly; ventral process of pygofer developed, length 0.5 times that of ventral margin of pygofer, ventral process at widest part narrower than basal width of pygofer about 1 : 5.5 . Pygofer subquadrate in ventral view (
Fig. 4
B), cleft at middle of apical margin, ventral process produced, bilobed, about 0.2 times median length of pygofer; each lobe about 0.2 times as wide as pygofer. Aedeagus, trapezoidal in lateral view (
Fig. 4
E). Genital styles (
Figs. 4
C, 4 D) with width of apical part about 0.8 times length ( WAGS : LAGS = 1 : 1.2 ) on outer side, margins prominent on inner side, complete.

Type specimen examined:
Lectotype of
Aphrophora auropilosa
Matsumura, 1907
: male, Koshun [= Henchun],
3 /VII 1906
, Formosa , Matsumura.

Distribution: China (Xizang, Sichuan, Yunnan, Fujian, and Hainan), Taiwan (included Lutao Is. and Orchid Is.), Philippines (Luzon), Indonesia ( Flores Is. and Lombok Is.).

Host plants: The species is widespread in Taiwan . Most of our examined specimens were collected either in Malaise traps or sweeping nets. We have found the nymphs on
Elatostema lineolatum Forst.
var. major Thwait.
( Urticaceae ) and
Rhus semialata Murr.
var. roxburghiana
DC. ( Anacardiaceae ) in the field.
